heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 10 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.8°C) and outside temperature (down 3.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 229 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1366 m), feels like temperature (up 6.9°C), outside temperature (up 5.0°C), and dew point temperature (up 1.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 228.7m lower than yesterday, 1055.0m lower than the past week, 1365.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 840m to a maximum of 1760m, averaging 924.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1979.5m and 2290m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
